page.title: 10NATURE IN THE WOLDS
page.content: Some interesting aspects of how wild plants have adapted to man's interference: normally found near the coast, a salt-loving mushroom {"Agaricus Bernedii"}has been thriving along the grass verges in the autumn and winter months (the salting of roads in winter has caused this to happen). Another salt lover from the east coast, a rare lily{"Star of {Bethlehem"}was also found on the grass verge. It thrived for two years until a well meaning council flail-mower shortened its height and its life! Certain garden plants have found a new lease of life by being dumped along local lanes, including{Aconite, {Michaelmas Daisy, Daffodil, Narcissus, {Pansy, Violet, Snowdrop, Golden Rod, {Rape, Berberis & Forget-Me-Not.
